title: 500 from RESTEasy Reactive with malformed Accept when multiple @Produces
body:
### Describe the bug

A resource method that has multiple `@Produces` annotations causes an internal server error if you send an Accept header with a malformed `q` value.

I'm sending this Accept header (as a minimal example, I'd tried many more): `*/*, a/b; q`. Note `q` is malformed. It should be `q=0.9` or similar.

And writing this resource:
```java
@Path("/")
class GreetingResource {
    @GET
    @Produces({APPLICATION_SVG_XML, APPLICATION_XML})
    public String get() {
        return "";
    }
}
```

### Expected behavior

In the case of a malformed Accept header, I would expect one of the following (in order of preference):
1. Another media type to be chosen.
2. a `406` response.
3. A `400` response.

### Actual behavior

A `RuntimeException` from `MediaTypeHelper#getQTypeWithParamInfo` is not handled, causing `500`.

```
2022-09-10 21:04:29,765 ERROR [io.qua.ver.htt.run.QuarkusErrorHandler] (vert.x-eventloop-thread-1) HTTP Request to /multipleUniNonNull failed, error id: 532de202-62fa-434b-94e8-bd35212114f4-4: java.lang.RuntimeException: Media type q value must be a float: a/b;q=
```

### How to Reproduce?

https://github.com/langsamu/quarkus-malformed-accept-runtime-exception

A minimal project with a [single resource](https://github.com/langsamu/quarkus-malformed-accept-runtime-exception/blob/main/src/main/java/org/acme/GreetingResource.java) that shows several failing and several working variations, as well as REST Assured JUnit [tests](https://github.com/langsamu/quarkus-malformed-accept-runtime-exception/blob/main/src/test/java/org/acme/GreetingResourceTest.java) to highlight the difference.

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

openjdk version "11.0.16.1" 2022-08-12 LTS

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

2.12.1.Final

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Apache Maven 3.8.6 (84538c9988a25aec085021c365c560670ad80f63)

### Additional information

_No response_
